Signal.description: A Signal Object (with label and auto dispose)

Signal ($ extension).description: A Signal Object (created with the $ extension)

Computed.description: The computed function lets you combine the values of multiple signals into a new signal that can be reacted to, or even used by additional computeds. When the signals accessed from within a computed callback change, the computed callback is re-executed and its new return value becomes the computed signalâ€™s value.

Computed ($ extension).description: A Computed Object (created with the $ extension)

AsyncComputed.description: Async Computed is syntax sugar around [FutureSignal].

ChangeStackSignal.description: Change stack is a way to track the signal values overtime and undo or redo values.

IterableSignal.description: Iterable signals can be created by extension or method and implement the Iterable interface.

ListSignal.description: List signals can be created by extension or method and implement the List interface.

MapSignal.description: Map signals can be created by extension or method and implement the Map interface.

SetSignal.description: Set signals can be created by extension or method and implement the Set interface.

FutureSignal.description: Returns AsyncState<T> for the value and can handle the various states.

TrackedSignal.description: A signal that tracks its previous and initial values.

LazySignal.description: A signal that is initialized lazily.

PersistedSignal (JSON).description: A signal that persists its value as JSON.

Watch.builder.description: To watch a signal for changes in Flutter, use the Watch widget. This will only rebuild this widget method and not the entire widget tree.

Watch.description: To watch a signal for changes in Flutter, use the Watch widget. This will only rebuild this widget method and not the entire widget tree.

Signal class with mixin.description: Create a signal class with a mixin
